name: ifnmfalse
params: class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3
body: |- wi(wnel(c0, c1), wceq(cif(c2, c3, wcel(c0, c1)), c3))

stmt.origin: sylbi(wnel(c0, c1), wceq(cif(c2, c3, wcel(c0, c1)), c3), wn(wcel(c0, c1)))
stmt.pretty: sylbi(c0 ∉ c1, if(c0 ∈ c1, c2, c3)= c3, ¬ c0 ∈ c1)

body.origin:
|- wi(wnel(c0, c1), wceq(cif(c2, c3, wcel(c0, c1)), c3))
-| wb(wnel(c0, c1), wn(wcel(c0, c1)))
-| wi(wn(wcel(c0, c1)), wceq(cif(c2, c3, wcel(c0, c1)), c3))

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(wnel(c0, c1), wceq(cif(c2, c3, wcel(c0, c1)), c3))
-| wb(wnel(c0, c1), wn(wcel(c0, c1)))
-| wi(wn(wcel(c0, c1)), wceq(cif(c2, c3, wcel(c0, c1)), c3))

|- wi(wnel(c0, c1), wceq(cif(c2, c3, wcel(c0, c1)), c3))
-| wi(wn(wcel(c0, c1)), wceq(cif(c2, c3, wcel(c0, c1)), c3))

body.origin: |- wi(wn(wcel(c0, c1)), wceq(cif(c2, c3, wcel(c0, c1)), c3))

cumulated.origin: |- wi(wnel(c0, c1), wceq(cif(c2, c3, wcel(c0, c1)), c3))

comment: If A is not a member of B, but an "if" condition requires it, then the "false" branch results. This is a simple utility to provide a slight shortening and simplification of proofs versus applying ~ iffalse directly in this case. (Contributed by David A. Wheeler, 15-May-2015.)
